title: Loading Screen Completes After Assets Ready
description: Verify that the loading screen is displayed initially and fades out only after all 3D assets and the first content section are fully loaded and ready.

steps.description: Navigate to the site landing page.
Check that the loading screen overlay is visible upon page load.
Verify that the loading screen fades out only after the 3D Spline model and the first section are fully loaded.
Assert that after fade out, the main content including header and 3D scene is visible.

title: Fixed Frosted Glass Header Rendering
description: Ensure the header remains fixed at the top with correct frosted glass effect, soft brand typography, and proper z-index layering throughout scrolling.

steps.description: Load the main page.
Verify the header is fixed and visible on viewport top.
Check the frosted glass visual effect is correctly applied and consistent on different backgrounds.
Scroll through each content section.
Confirm the header retains its fixed position, layering above other page elements, with no flicker or z-index issues.

title: 3D Spline Scene Rendering and Camera Transitions
description: Validate that the central 3D Spline object renders correctly and camera transitions synchronize smoothly with user scroll and section changes.

steps.description: Load the page and wait for the 3D Spline scene to render.
Confirm the 3D model is present, correctly textured, and fully interactive.
Scroll through the four main content sections slowly.
Verify the camera transitions smoothly between predefined viewpoints, tied to the active content section.
Use wall navigation to jump between sections.
Confirm camera transitions animate smoothly without janks or visual glitches.

title: Wall Navigation Functionality and Accessibility
description: Test wall navigation component highlights the active section properly, supports keyboard navigation, and announces active section to screen readers.

steps.description: Load the page and verify wall navigation component is displayed fixed on screen.
Scroll through content sections and observe wall navigation highlight updates.
Check that the currently active section indicator in the wall navigation updates correspondingly.
Use keyboard TAB and arrow keys to navigate through the wall navigation items.
Confirm keyboard focus moves properly and navigation triggers scroll to correct sections.
Validate that screen readers announce the active section and keyboard focus states appropriately.

title: Scroll Indicator Behavior
description: Verify scroll indicator pulses near the fold initially and fades out after the user's first scroll interaction.

steps.description: Load the website and observe the scroll indicator near the viewport fold.
Confirm the scroll indicator pulses as per animation timing guidelines.
Perform the first scroll action by the user.
Check that the scroll indicator fades out smoothly after the first scroll.
Scroll back up to verify indicator remains hidden.
Scroll indicator does not reappear after initial fade out.

title: Section 2 Date and Location Alignment
description: Validate strict left alignment of dates and right alignment of locations in Section 2 to avoid overlap with the central 3D scene.

steps.description: Navigate or scroll directly to Section 2.
Verify dates are aligned strictly on the left side.
Verify locations are aligned strictly on the right side.
Confirm there is no visual overlap or collision with the central 3D spline scene.
Test on various screen sizes and device types.
Ensure alignment holds and no layout shifts or breakage occur.

title: Smooth Scrolling Integration via Lenis
description: Check that smooth scrolling using Lenis works correctly without performance issues, jank, double scroll handlers, or keyboard navigation conflicts.

steps.description: Load the page and observe scrolling behavior.
Verify scrolling is smooth and GPU accelerated.
Attempt keyboard navigation using arrow keys, page up/down, and spacebar.
Confirm keyboard navigation scrolls page correctly with no disruption.
Check browser performance tools to ensure no double scroll event listeners or jank.
Lenis integration does not cause any conflicts or degraded responsiveness.

title: Animation Timing and Easing Compliance
description: Verify that all UI fades and scroll transitions comply with prescribed animation durations and easing functions.

steps.description: Trigger UI fades such as loading screen fade out and content section fades.
Measure animation durations and confirm fades do not exceed 1.2 seconds.
Trigger scroll-based camera transitions or section changes.
Ensure scroll transitions complete within 2 seconds using defined easing.

title: Performance Metrics Validation
description: Ensure performance goals for First Contentful Paint (FCP) and Time to Interactive (TTI) are met on mid-tier devices.

steps.description: Load the site on a mid-tier device or emulator with throttled CPU/network.
Measure First Contentful Paint and confirm it completes within 2.5 seconds.
Measure Time to Interactive and verify it is under 4 seconds.

title: Accessibility Checks for Keyboard, Contrast, and Reduced Motion
description: Validate keyboard navigability, sufficient color contrast, and respect for reduced motion preferences site-wide.

steps.description: Navigate through all interactive elements using keyboard only.
Confirm focus is clearly visible and navigation order is logical.
Use automated accessibility tools and manual color contrast checks on UI elements.
Verify no WCAG 2.1 AA contrast violations.
Enable user OS reduced motion preference and reload site.
Check that all animations are reduced or disabled in compliance with reduced motion settings.

title: Vignette Overlay Toggle and Performance Fallback
description: Test that vignette overlay displays subtly by default and can be toggled off to improve performance on low-power devices.

steps.description: Load the page and verify vignette overlay is visible and subtle.
Toggle vignette overlay off via UI controls or developer settings.
Confirm vignette overlay disappears and performance improves.
Simulate low-power mode or error states.
Check for fallback activations such as static hero image and disabled animations.

title: Mobile Responsive Layout and Motion Simplification
description: Verify that the site adapts layout and reduces motion on mobile devices to maintain a consistent and performant experience.

steps.description: Open site on various mobile devices and simulators.
Validate simplified content layouts are applied, avoiding desktop-specific overlaps or tight spacing.
Confirm scroll-driven animations and 3D scene interactions use reduced motion variants.
Check device type detection triggers correct styling and component variants.
Ensure smooth scrolling remains functional and no UI breaks occur.

title: Error Handling and Fallback Activation
description: Test system behavior when 3D assets fail to load or in low-power mode, including fallback to static hero images and disabling advanced motion features.

steps.description: Simulate 3D asset loading failure or trigger low-power device mode.
Verify that a static hero image is displayed in place of the 3D spline scene.
Confirm that all advanced motion animations are disabled or replaced with static alternatives.
Check that the site remains navigable and functional with no uncaught errors or crashes.

title: Section Content Integrity and Layout Stability
description: Ensure all four content sections and modular cards render correctly with cinematic scroll animations, no layout shifts, and content does not overlap or cause visual glitches across devices.

steps.description: Scroll through each of the four main content sections sequentially.
Verify that sections animate in with subtle fade and transform effects compliant with animation guidelines.
Confirm modular cards within sections render properly and respond to scroll-triggered animations.
Test on multiple screen sizes including mobile, tablet, and desktop.
Ensure no layout shifts occur during loading or scrolling and no content overlaps within or between sections.
